lines.text: Enter a Doctor of Physic and a WaitingGentlewoman

lines.speaker: doctor
lines.text: I have two nights watched with you, but can perceive no truth in your report. When was it she last walked

lines.speaker: gentlewoman
lines.text: Since his majesty went into the field, I have seen her rise from her bed, throw her nightgown upon her, unlock her closet, take forth paper, fold it, write upont, read it, afterwards seal it, and again return to bed yet all this while in a most fast sleep.

lines.speaker: doctor
lines.text: A great perturbation in nature, to receive at once the benefit of sleep, and do the effects of watching! In this slumbery agitation, besides her walking and other actual performances, what, at any time, have you heard her say

lines.speaker: gentlewoman
lines.text: That, sir, which I will not report after her.

lines.speaker: doctor
lines.text: You may to me: and tis most meet you should.

lines.speaker: gentlewoman
lines.text: Neither to you nor any one having no witness to confirm my speech. Lo you, here she comes! This is her very guise and, upon my life, fast asleep. Observe her stand close.
Enter LADY MACBETH, with a taper

lines.speaker: doctor
lines.text: How came she by that light

lines.speaker: gentlewoman
lines.text: Why, it stood by her: she has light by her continually tis her command.

lines.speaker: doctor
lines.text: You see, her eyes are open.

lines.speaker: gentlewoman
lines.text: Ay, but their sense is shut.

lines.speaker: doctor
lines.text: What is it she does now Look, how she rubs her hands.

lines.speaker: gentlewoman
lines.text: It is an accustomed action with her, to seem thus washing her hands: I have known her continue in this a quarter of an hour.

lines.speaker: lady macbeth
lines.text: Yet heres a spot.

lines.speaker: doctor
lines.text: Hark! she speaks: I will set down what comes from her, to satisfy my remembrance the more strongly.

lines.speaker: lady macbeth
lines.text: Out, damned spot! out, I say!One: two: why, then, tis time to dot.Hell is murky!Fie, my lord, fie! a soldier, and afeard What need we fear who knows it, when none can call our power to accountYet who would have thought the old man to have had so much blood in him.

lines.speaker: doctor
lines.text: Do you mark that

lines.speaker: lady macbeth
lines.text: The thane of Fife had a wife: where is she now What, will these hands neer be cleanNo more o that, my lord, no more o that: you mar all with this starting.

lines.speaker: doctor
lines.text: Go to, go to you have known what you should not.

lines.speaker: gentlewoman
lines.text: She has spoke what she should not, I am sure of that: heaven knows what she has known.

lines.speaker: lady macbeth
lines.text: Heres the smell of the blood still: all the perfumes of Arabia will not sweeten this little hand. Oh, oh, oh!

lines.speaker: doctor
lines.text: What a sigh is there! The heart is sorely charged.

lines.speaker: gentlewoman
lines.text: I would not have such a heart in my bosom for the dignity of the whole body.

lines.speaker: doctor
lines.text: Well, well, well,

lines.speaker: gentlewoman
lines.text: Pray God it be, sir.

lines.speaker: doctor
lines.text: This disease is beyond my practise: yet I have known those which have walked in their sleep who have died holily in their beds.

lines.speaker: lady macbeth
lines.text: Wash your hands, put on your nightgown look not so pale.I tell you yet again, Banquos buried he cannot come out ons grave.

lines.speaker: doctor
lines.text: Even so

lines.speaker: lady macbeth
lines.text: To bed, to bed! theres knocking at the gate: come, come, come, come, give me your hand. Whats done cannot be undone.To bed, to bed, to bed!
Exit

lines.speaker: doctor
lines.text: Will she go now to bed

lines.speaker: gentlewoman
lines.text: Directly.

lines.speaker: doctor
lines.text: Foul whisperings are abroad: unnatural deeds Do breed unnatural troubles: infected minds To their deaf pillows will discharge their secrets: More needs she the divine than the physician. God, God forgive us all! Look after her Remove from her the means of all annoyance, And still keep eyes upon her. So, good night: My mind she has mated, and amazed my sight. I think, but dare not speak.

lines.speaker: gentlewoman
lines.text: Good night, good doctor.
Exeunt
